page.title: 03LANDSCAPE IN HAMBLEDON
page.content: {HISTORIC BUILDINGS IN HAMBLEDON.} {THE HIGH STREET:}Now a conservation area,remains of cobbled street;many timber framed houses c.1450 which are now brick or plaster fronted. Langtry's the Butchers is old enough to have no original chimney.Shutters suggest it was a shop in Tudor times. { MANOR FARM:}c.1200,with a solar and a medieval roof and hall.The south wall has three filled in arches which were once doorways leading possibly to sleeping quarters and courtyard.It is possible that the kitchen was outside to avoid cooking smells in living quarters.Also the river which once ran down East and West Streets skirted the Manor on the south.Timber framed buildings were added on the north side 1550-1700.These have been brick faced and a porch added to the front.
